intro: Varilla mexicana var. gypsophila, commonly known as the Mexican gypsophila, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae and is characterized by its delicate, lace-like flowers that resemble those of the genus Gypsophila. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun conditions. It has slender, upright stems with small, ovate leaves that are usually covered in fine hairs. The flowers are usually pink to white in color and bloom in late spring to early summer.
